title: 109_hr4842
content: The "Port Security Act of 2006" prohibits leases of real property and facilities at United States ports by foreign government-owned entities. The Defense Production Act of 1950 is amended to prohibit foreign government-owned entities from leasing, operating, managing, or owning real property or facilities at United States ports. The President is required to submit a report within 30 days of the enactment of this Act. The President must report to Congress on foreign government-owned entities leasing, operating, or owning property at US ports. The report includes a list of these entities, an assessment of national security threats, and recommendations for legislation in response. SEC. 3. INCREASED TRANSPARENCY OF MANDATORY INVESTIGATIONS. Section 271(b) of the Defense Production Act of 1950 is amended to require the President to notify Congress within one day of commencing an investigation regarding a proposed merger, acquisition, or takeover. Notification must include relevant information and ownership records provided to key congressional leaders. The President must notify key congressional leaders, including Chairmen and Ranking Members of various committees in the Senate and House of Representatives, as well as Members of Congress representing affected states and districts, within one day of commencing an investigation into a proposed merger, acquisition, or takeover under an amendment to Section 271(b) of the Defense Production Act of 1950. States and districts affected by the proposed transaction must be notified by the President within one day of commencing an investigation into a merger, acquisition, or takeover involving a foreign government entity leasing, operating, managing, or owning real property at a United States port. This notification includes providing relevant information and ownership records to Governors and heads of relevant government agencies in the states where the ports are located. The President must notify states and districts affected by a proposed merger, acquisition, or takeover involving a foreign government entity at a US port. Within 7 days of starting an investigation, a description of the transaction is published for public comments. A summary of public comments is published 10 days before completing the investigation. SEC. 4 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 is amended to correct a technical error by changing subsection (c) to subsection (d). SEC. 5 states that these amendments apply to any merger, acquisition, or takeover considered on or after October 1, 2005 under section 271 of the Act.
